bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, October 12, 1952

div1.p: Nogueira sends Hench a list of names to be engraved on memorial plaques for the dedication of Camp Lazear. He explains why some were included and others excluded.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, October 12, 1952
div1.p:
COPY
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Medico Cirujano
Marti 219, Marianao
Telefono: BO-7577
Marianao October 12 or 1952 Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota, U.S..A.
Dear Philip:

According to my former letters and after discussing the matter with the Patrones
members, it has been agreed that the names to be put on the plates are those who
served as volunteers on the Lazear's Camp, or rather these mentioned here below:
Alvarez
Benigno
Fernandez
Folk
Hanberry
Jernegan
Kissinger
Martinez
Moran
Presedo
Sonntag
Weatherwalks
West

For this list could be added the names of the fomites volunteers:
Cooke
England
Hildebrand.

And besides those on blood inoculations on Lazear's Camp, not included among the
upper groups:
Andrus
Forbes
Olsen

It is agreed on not include the inoculations made by carroll and Reed on Columbia
Barracks with fresh and warm serum, why those were not done in the Camp.

Neither are those made before by Lazear on Columbia Barracks nor Dr. Guiteras
series and Finlay and Delgado (although they are made 5 experimental inocula-
tions on San Jose Farm in 1883). In one word, only those on active service
are included.

Gorgas' name is left out as he has a memorial on Finlay Park in Havana, and with
regard to Stark, being Reed's substitute doesnt merit sufficient, why it is un-
known whether his influence got in the work relized.

Philip I want your sound opinion on this as custom which I pray your quickest reply
waiting to send the job to the foundery and have time to get them through for
the 3rd of December answer me right away.

On the other hand I'm mailing the negatives of views by registered airmail next
Thursday. They are several for you to choose those you like best and from them
we can take as many is necessary. Together are some photos taken on the Camp
some persons on visit due to the Hygiene Congress.

Right now we are working with the brick layers and electricians and hope on
month end to have the caseta totally finished to be able to send you some pic-
tures, and that the park would be well on the way on that date and you would be
able to appreciate it on the photos.

We are also making the program for 3rd December and we's like to know if somebody
from the U.S.A. should occupy a space to be able to notify him on time.

Philip, I am happy because up to now we are on the way and we will soon see
what we long hoped for.
Philip excuse again my English, every day is worse.
